description: President Donald Trump said he would look to reinstate weaker automobile emissions standards to levels he imposed during his first term, saying environmental regulations imposed by former President Joe Biden were too onerous for automakers.
title: Trump Says He’ll Bring Back Less Stringent Auto Emissions Standards

description: The UK government will pass legislation compelling companies providing IT services to critical national infrastructure to improve their cyber defenses after a wave of attacks by Russia, China, Iran and North Korea.
title: UK to Compel 1,000 Firms to Shore Up Cyber Defenses After Hacks

description: Marine Le Pen’s election ban risks a surge in anti-establishment sentiment in France that could undermine efforts to stabilize the nation’s creaky public finances.
title: Le Pen Election Ban Threatens Fragile Peace in French Politics

description: President Donald Trump said the first presidential trip of his second term would likely include visits to Saudi Arabia, the United Arab Emirates, and Qatar as well as additional stops.
title: Trump Plans Visits to Saudi Arabia, UAE, Qatar in First Foreign Trip

description: President Donald Trump floated former US ambassador to Israel David Friedman and special envoy Ric Grenell as potential picks for ambassador to the United Nations, after a narrow House Republican majority led him to rescind Representative Elise Stefanik’s nomination.
title: Trump Floats Friedman, Grenell as Possible Picks for UN Envoy

description: US President Donald Trump said he believed Russian President Vladimir Putin would follow through on striking a ceasefire agreement and accused Ukraine of attempting to negotiate an economic deal with the US, in the latest turn in his whipsaw effort to negotiate a temporary truce in the ongoing conflict.
title: Trump Says Putin Will ‘Follow Through,’ Rebuffs Ukraine on Deal

description: Australia’s center-right opposition will press the nation’s bank regulator to ease its mortgage lending standards in order to allow more people to borrow to buy a home if it wins office next month.
title: Australia Opposition Wants Bank Regulator to Ease Loan Standards

description: US President Donald Trump offered support for far-right French leader Marine Le Pen after she was convicted of embezzlement and likened her legal woes to the prosecutions he faced before retaking power.
title: Trump Says Le Pen Conviction Is ‘Big Deal,’ Similar to His Cases

description: Today on the Big Take podcast: Trump says that no country will be spared in his latest round of tariffs, due to be announced Wednesday.
title: Everything We Know — And Don’t — About Trump’s Planned Tariffs

description: US Trade Representative Jamieson Greer will testify before Congress next week, just days after President Donald Trump announces what is expected to be a sweeping tariff agenda, according to a person familiar with the plans.
title: USTR Greer Slated to Defend Trump Tariffs to Congress Next Week

description: President Donald Trump signed an executive order to establish an office within the Commerce Department to facilitate and speed up investments of more than $1 billion in the US and administer federal funds from the Chips and Science Act.
title: Trump Creates Investment Office to Oversee Chips Act Funds

description: US automakers are lobbying the Trump administration to exclude certain vehicle parts from tariffs as part of a last-ditch effort to influence the levies before they start taking effect this week, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: US Automakers Lobby to Exclude Low-Cost Parts From Tariffs

description: The Social Security Administration said it’s investigating the cause of recent incidents that have prevented beneficiaries from accessing their online accounts, after the portal went down temporarily.
title: Social Security Website Crashes as Agency Pushes Users Online

description: His plans have sparked fears of a US recession and a global slowdown, as well as the end of a post-war order.
title: Trump's Tariffs Set to Make History and Break a System MAGA Loathes

description: His plans have sparked fears of a US recession and a global slowdown, as well as the end of a post-war order.
title: Trump's Tariffs Set to Make History and Break a System MAGA Loathes

description: Colombia’s President Gustavo Petro attacked the central bank and accused it of trying to hurt the economy after the board defied his calls for lower interest rates at its March policy meeting.
title: Petro Accuses Colombia Central Bank of Trying to Sabotage Growth

description: President Donald Trump is expected to sign an executive order on Monday aimed at cracking down on ticket scalping and fees that drive up the costs of attending live events for consumers.
title: Trump to Target Ticket Scalping, Fees With New Executive Order

description: President Donald Trump’s sweeping executive order directing major changes to US voter registration and how mail-in ballots are counted is being challenged in a lawsuit by human rights groups, which called the measures unconstitutional.
title: Trump Sued Over Order to Require Proof of Citizenship to Vote

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Every Monday, Bloomberg Intelligence senior analyst Nathan Dean gives his insights into what’s been happening and what’s coming up in the nooks and crannies of government and markets.  Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Trump Keeps Everyone Guessing on His Next Round of Tariffs

description: The Trump administration will review Harvard University’s federal contracts and grants as part of an investigation into alleged antisemitism.
title: Trump Administration to Review Billions in Grants to Harvard

description: President Donald Trump claimed days of US strikes have “decimated” Houthi rebels whose attacks have disrupted commercial traffic in the Red Sea but gave no details about the campaign, raising fresh questions about its effectiveness.
title: Trump Says Houthis ‘Decimated’ But ‘Real Pain’ Yet to Come

description: Cantor Fitzgerald biotech analysts slammed the leadership of Health and Human Services Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr., calling on the Trump administration to “re-evaluate” his role after a top vaccine official stepped down.
title: Cantor Analysts Blast RFK Jr., Warn of ‘Dangerous Territory’

description: Venezuelan men wearing Michael Jordan jerseys and sporting tattoos have been unfairly branded as “alien enemy” gang members worthy of deportation, according to lawyers challenging the Trump administration.
title: Michael Jordan Jerseys, Tattoos: Trump's 'Alien Enemy' Guide Challenged by Lawyers

description: French far-right leader Marine Le Pen lashed out at the decision to bar her from running for elected office for five years, saying it effectively eliminated her from the 2027 presidential race.
title: Le Pen Blasts ‘Political’ Ruling That Bars French Election Bid

description: New Zealand is seeing “red hot” interest in its revamped golden visa program from the US and Europe as rising geopolitical tensions prompt wealthy people to consider options abroad, Immigration Minister Erica Stanford said.
title: Golden Visa Revamp Tempts Wealthy to Eye New Zealand as Haven

description: The conviction of Marine Le Pen for embezzlement may well dash her chances of replacing Emmanuel Macron as French president in 2027, and leaves the far-right party that became the country’s main opposition under her stewardship facing an uncertain future.
title: Why the French Far Right Depends on Marine Le Pen

description: President Donald Trump will announce his reciprocal tariff push on Wednesday during an event in the White House Rose Garden, his top spokeswoman said.
title: Trump to Unveil Country-Based Tariffs April 2 in Rose Garden

description: US Representative Elise Stefanik was supposed to be done with the Ivy League. Now she’s back, and already turning up the heat on Columbia University.
title: Ivy League Tormentor Stefanik Returns, Lashes Out at Columbia

description: The Trump administration is sanctioning six Hong Kong officials, including the city’s justice secretary and police commissioner, in the latest steps to target authorities implementing Beijing’s hardline policies.
title: US Sanctions More Hong Kong Officials Amid Beijing-Led Crackdown

description: Government officials from Botswana will meet with South Africa’s electricity ministry this week after power-import costs more than doubled, worsening a supply crisis.
title: Botswana Seeks New Eskom Power Deal as Supply Crisis Deepens

description: President Donald Trump has included potash among the minerals that need an immediately ramp up in US production. That’s unlikely to significantly break America’s reliance on fertilizer imports.
title: Trump Push for US Fertilizer Won’t Be Enough to Replace Imports

description: President Donald Trump’s media venture is forging a symbolic link to Texas, becoming the first company to list on the New York Stock Exchange’s upstart outpost in the Lone Star State.
title: Trump Media Will Become First Listing for NYSE’s Texas Outpost

description: Thabo Mbeki, who succeeded Nelson Mandela to become the second president of democratic South Africa, has entered a legal fray between the government and the families of victims of apartheid-era crimes.
title: Mandela’s Successor Mbeki Says He’s Target of Apartheid Case

description: Spain called on the European Union to move ahead with a discussion about seizing Russia’s frozen central bank assets as the bloc explores ways to provide continued support to Ukraine.
title: Spain Seeks to Push Forward EU Debate on Seizing Russian Assets

description: The International Monetary Fund and World Bank are making their case against a potential breakup with the US under President Donald Trump.
title: IMF and World Bank Brace for Trump’s ‘America First’ Makeover

description: South Africa’s Public Works Minister Dean Macpherson, 40, said he plans to create a state-owned company that will manage the government’s real estate portfolio and entice private investment into infrastructure projects.
title: South Africa Plans Firm to Manage $8.4 Billion of State Property

description: Liberal Leader Mark Carney promised his government would get back in the business of homebuilding with a plan he’s pitching as Canada’s most ambitious since World War II.
title: Carney Vows to Revive Canada’s Wartime-Era Homebuilding Strategy

description: The US stock market rout intensified on Monday on fears that President Donald Trump’s next tariff rollout will deliver a shock to the global economy, with rising recession concerns leaving the S&P 500 Index on track for its worst quarter compared to the rest of the world since the 1980s.
title: US Stocks Swoon as Trump Sows Economic Fear Across Wall Street

description: Conservative Leader Pierre Poilievre vowed to fast-track approvals for necessary infrastructure to transport Canadian energy domestically and abroad without going through the US.
title: Conservatives Pitch Canada ‘Energy Corridor’ to End US Reliance

description: Austria won’t be able to avoid being reprimanded by the European Union for running an outsized deficit as last year’s economic developments were worse than feared, according to Finance Minister Markus Marterbauer.
title: Austria Sees EU Budget Reprimand Unavoidable as Deficit Spirals

description: The UK is expecting to be impacted by US tariffs this week, even as intensive talks continue to secure an exemption for British goods, Prime Minister Keir Starmer’s office said.
title: UK Expects to Be Hit by US Tariffs This Week as Talks Continue

description: As costs soar and climate risks mount, there are no easy answers for LA’s recovery. So one block in Altadena is working together to get home.
title: LA Fire Victims Are Betting on a Radical Idea to Help Them Rebuild

description: Far-right leader Marine Le Pen’s presidential ambitions were dealt a potential death blow after she was convicted of embezzlement by a French court and barred from running in the next election in 2027.
title: Marine Le Pen Barred From 2027 French Presidency Run

description: The Israeli army told Palestinians to leave areas in southern Gaza ahead of what it said would be “intense fighting” with Hamas, a sign it plans to extend ground operations in the enclave after a ceasefire collapsed earlier this month.
title: Israel Tells Gazans to Leave Border Area Before ‘Intense Fight’

description: Poland will sign a $2 billion contract with the US on Monday to supply logistical support for Patriot missile-defense systems, the country’s defense chief told broadcaster Polsat.
title: Poland to Sign $2 Billion Deal With US for Air-Defense Program

description: The co-head of Germany’s Social Democrats party and frontrunner to become the next finance minister Lars Klingbeil dismissed swirling speculation over reviving pipeline gas deliveries from Russia after a potential peace deal for Ukraine.
title: Germany’s Klingbeil Rebuffs Calls to Restore Russian Gas Imports

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: South Sudan on the Brink Risks Triggering Wider Conflict

description: A blaze at a Tesla Inc. electric-vehicle dealership in Rome left 17 cars damaged, according to local fire services.
title: Tesla Dealership Fire in Rome Leaves 17 Vehicles Damaged

description: Far-right leader Marine Le Pen was convicted of embezzlement by a Paris court — but judges haven’t yet said if she will pick up a ban that stops her from running to be France’s next president.
title: France’s Le Pen Found Guilty in Case Over Misuse of EU Funds

description: Spain will urge the European Union’s top diplomat to strengthen the bloc’s engagement with Africa’s Sahel region as part of a broader defense review, according to a person familiar with the matter.
title: Spain to Ask the EU to Strengthen Policy Towards Africa’s Sahel

description: Pete Hegseth’s message to American allies on his first two overseas trips as US defense secretary could not have been more different.
title: Hegseth’s Good Cop, Bad Cop Approach to Allies Shows China Focus

description: Greenland’s new prime minister said Donald Trump won’t get the arctic island, the first comments he’s made since forming a government on Friday.
title: Greenland’s New Prime Minister Says Trump Won’t Get Island

description: President Xi Jinping is set to visit three Southeast Asian nations on his first overseas trip this year, the South China Morning Post reported, citing people familiar with the matter.
title: Xi to Visit Vietnam, Malaysia, Cambodia in April, SCMP Says

description: South Africa’s Democratic Alliance, the second-biggest group in the country’s coalition government, sees a “good chance” of an agreement on the nation’s budget this week, the party’s spokesman said. The rand strengthened.
title: South Africa’s DA Sees ‘Good Chance’ of Budget Deal by Wednesday

description: Elon Musk acknowledged that his job as head of President Donald Trump’s effort to cut the size of government is “costing me a lot” when it comes to his other big job, as CEO of Tesla Inc.
title: Musk Sees Tesla as a ‘Buying Opportunity’ Despite DOGE Blowback

description: Israel named Eli Sharvit as the new head of the country’s domestic intelligence agency after political rifts led to the dismissal of his predecessor.
title: Netanyahu Names New Intelligence Agency Chief, Defying Court

description: Japan’s parliament is set to pass an initial budget after multiple revisions, easing some of the pressure on Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba as he faces a host of domestic and diplomatic challenges.
title: Japan to Approve Budget Just a Day Before New Fiscal Year Begins

description: The British chancellor needs to break free from her box of hopeless promises.
title: Rachel Reeves Risks a Doom Loop of Her Own Making

description: Giorgia Meloni had hoped a line in to Donald Trump would consolidate her position at the center of European politics.
title: The Costs of Courting Trump Are Piling Up for Giorgia Meloni

description: Two senior members of the German conservative CDU/CSU bloc led by Friedrich Merz are demanding a reversal of the legalization of cannabis last year by the outgoing Socialist SPD-led “traffic light” coalition, the Augsburger Allgemeine reported, a reminder of a divisive issue that could sour talks about a new coalition government.
title: Merz Allies Urge End to German Cannabis Legalization: Augsburger

description: South Korea’s interim leader Han Duck-soo faces the threat of yet another impeachment proceeding as the Constitutional Court drags out its deliberations on President Yoon Suk Yeol’s political fate, irking politicians in both the liberal and conservative camps.
title: South Korea’s Han Under Pressure as Yoon Ruling Wait Drags On

description: China’s factory activity continued to expand in March, welcome news for the world’s No. 2 economy before expected US tariffs that could further strain trade ties.
title: China Factory Activity Expands Before Expected Trump Tariffs

description: President Donald Trump said he plans to start his reciprocal tariff push with “all countries,” tamping down speculation that he could limit the initial scope of tariffs set to be unveiled April 2.
title: Trump Says Reciprocal Tariffs Set to Start With All Countries

description: Asian leaders face tough decisions as President Donald Trump’s reciprocal tariffs pose a generational challenge to a region whose economies were built around exports to the US and a world of low trade barriers.
title: Asia Braces for Historic Test of Export Model From Trump Tariffs
